about_the_game:
Dwellling deep in the Silence, these ancient beings have haunted Irdheim and Sonnan for countless cycles. Stuck between life and death, their insatiable craving for the Hymn forbids them to fade away...

Wield the arcane powers of the Lighteaters against your opponents in Skirmish single- or multiplayer, with Songs of Silence's first faction DLC!

Content overview of the Lighteaters DLC

The DLC focuses on providing fresh Skirmish content.

  • 2 new hero archetypes

  • 6 new hero vocations

  • 8 new units

  • 5 new strategy cards (including 1 new building upgrade)

  • 8 new battles cards

  • 1 new unit perk

  • 1 new capital

Note: DLC owners can still fight against players that do not own it in Multiplayer!

 

Breakdown of the Lighteaters DLC

Lighteaters give and take life as they please. Using a variety of healing and self-damaging mechanics, they toy with the Hymn present in every living being...

Their Nexus capital is the cornerstone of their might, housing most of their recruitment options. By using the Nexus Recall strategy card, Lighteaters instantly teleport back to it to cash in loot, recruit new units, or escape from dangerous situations.

They can also conjure an extension of their Nexus through the Nexus Gateway building upgrade, to recruit and push on in their hunt for Hymn.

New Hero Classes (2x3 Hero Vocations)

  • Ancient Lighteaters - Punished for defying the Celestial Gods, they exist in a state between life and death. Their insatiable craving for the Hymn forbids them to fade away.

  • Gluttons - Ever hungry Lighteaters that command a titanic aura and assemble hordes of Gestalts under their banner.

New Units

  • Gladiator, Gardist

  • Mowl, Mawling

  • Lightstarved, Lesser Lighteater

  • Collector, Shrieker

Strategy Cards

  • Devour Light

  • Equivalent Exchange

  • Monument of Silence

  • Nexus Recall

  • Nexus Gateway – Building upgrade

Battle Cards

  • Abyssal Maw

  • Abyssal Howl

  • Drain light

  • Mind control

  • Project Aura

  • Sacrifice

  • Tainted Spark

  • Unholy intervention

Collector Unit Perk

  • Stationed in locations, units with this perk will yield additional gold or faction income.

Nexus Capital

  • The Nexus is the birthplace of those tortured souls who can neither live nor die and must feast on the Hymn of others.
